node.title: The Better.com C.E.O. says he’s ‘deeply sorry’ for firing workers over Zoom.
node.description: Vishal Garg said in a letter to employees on Tuesday that he had failed to show “respect and appreciation” in the call, which has been widely criticized.

node.title: Brooklyn Museum Gets a New President and Chief Operating Officer
node.description: Kimberly Panicek Trueblood will run the business side of an institution that has struggled financially and plans to refresh its building and galleries.

node.title: How Tech is Helping Poor People Get Government Aid
node.description: Even as the government expanded aid programs, many people faced barriers to using them. That problem is now being addressed with apps and streamlined websites.

node.title: Man in Critical Condition After Ambulance Taking Him to Hospital Hit by Bus
node.description: Four people were hospitalized after the crash in Milwaukee, including two other people in the Bell ambulance and the bus driver.

node.title: Teen Smacks Shark After Predator Bites Friend at the Beach
node.description: Jack Shaw and his friend were neck-deep in water when the shark attacked.

node.title: Great White Sharks Are Congregating Around the Carolinas Before Mating Season Begins
node.description: Tagging data shows how white sharks are migrating south along the U.S. East Coast for winter.

node.title: Juror Recant on Manslaughter Conviction Could Force Florida Judge to Declare Mistrial
node.description: When each of the jurors were asked whether they agreed with the manslaughter verdict, a standard trial practice, the first juror who was polled answered "No."

node.title: Amazon Quiet on What Caused Hours-Long Outage for Major Websites, Airlines
node.description: An outage at Amazon Web Services Tuesday affected everything from streaming services to airlines for about five hours.

node.title: Tijuana-based Kidnapping Ring That Killed 6, Including 3 U.S. Citizens, Arrested in Mexico
node.description: German Garcia Yera Hernandez and five other alleged participants in the ring face life in prison or the death penalty if convicted.

node.title: Prehistoric Crab Leg Found During Beach Clean-Up Could Be Up to 2 Million Years Old
node.description: A woman noticed the "interesting" and unusual artifact while picking up trash along a Virginia beach.

node.title: Calls for removal of Boebert after anti-Muslim remarks
node.description: The Colorado Republican was seen in a video describing anti-Muslim comments she made about Representative Ilhan Omar, a Minnesota Democrat.

node.title: Job openings near record high, with 11 million vacancies
node.description: Americans are still quitting at high rates, although fewer people handed in their resignations in October.

node.title: Man arrested after allegedly setting Fox News Christmas tree on fire
node.description: The 50-foot tree filled with 10,000 glass ornaments and 100,000 lights was burned down.

node.title: What to Cook Right Now
node.description: Try a comforting, creamy orzo recipe from Melissa Clark and a wintry menu from David Tanis.

node.title: A Penny for Your Squats?
node.description: Among 52 incentives to exercise, giving people a 9-cent award if they returned to the gym after missing a workout helped the most.

node.title: Can an Athlete’s Blood Enhance Brainpower?
node.description: Scientists who injected idle mice with blood from athletic mice found improvements in learning and memory. The findings could have implications for Alzheimer’s research and beyond.

node.title: Here are the charges that Kimberly Potter faces.
node.description: The police officer who shot and killed Mr. Wright during a traffic stop faces two felony counts; both are for manslaughter, not murder.

node.title: Some Jan. 6 Rioters May Use Police Brutality as a Defense
node.description: Half a dozen defendants in the assault on the Capitol are using video to try to make a case that they were simply protecting themselves and others. They face skepticism and an uphill legal battle.

node.title: Merkel Departs, Opening a New Chapter for Germany and Europe
node.description: After 16 years, Angela Merkel handed over the German chancellery to Olaf Scholz, leaving behind a changed country and a polarizing legacy.

node.title: Five Ways Biden-Putin Talks Were Very Different to Those Between Trump-Putin
node.description: The leaders met in person in June in Geneva and their virtual talks reiterated the difference in U.S.-Russia diplomacy between Putin and Donald Trump.

node.title: Norway Sets Indoor Gathering Limits, Forcing Nobel Peace Prize Ceremony to Scale Back
node.description: Norway has rolled out new mandates limiting public events with unassigned seating to 50 people, as well as limiting private gatherings to 10 people.

node.title: Camel Beauty Contest Sees 40 Disqualified for Botox, Other Cosmetic Procedures
node.description: The contest held during the King Abdulaziz Camel Festival in Saudi Arabia had its biggest crackdown in its more than 20-year history.

node.title: Two Men Allegedly Kidnapped, Killed Man After Being Told He Sexually Abused 6-Year-Old
node.description: Both men have been charged with murder and are facing the death penalty after hunters found the victim's naked body in the woods.

node.title: COVID, Inflation and Everyday Bills Top List of Concerns for Americans, Poll Finds
node.description: As prices rise, the number of Americans who say that paying for groceries is easy has declined by 13 percentage points over the past two years.

node.title: Photo Shows Kellogg's Products Out of Stock as Employees Prolong Strike
node.description: About 1,400 Kellogg's staff at plants in Battle Creek, Michigan, Omaha, Nebraska, Lancaster, Pennsylvania, and Memphis, Tennessee, are on strike.

node.title: U.K. Joins U.S., Australia Boycott of Beijing Olympics, Still Sending Athletes to Compete
node.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson said the U.K. will join in the diplomatic boycott, but he doesn't support boycotts involving athletes and they may compete.

node.title: Who Is Janette Miller? Appraiser Sued by Black Couple Who Accuse Her of Lowballing Them
node.description: Tenisha Tate-Austin and Paul Austin filed a lawsuit after a second appraisal of their California home produced a valuation almost half a million dollars higher than Miller's estimate.

node.title: "Mr. Optimist": Michael J. Fox reflects 30 years after Parkinson's diagnosis
node.description: Michael J. Fox was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease​ when he was 29 years old.

node.title: Unvaccinated Austrians to Remain in Lockdown, Have Limits On Why They Can Leave Home
node.description: The current lockdown permits people to leave their homes only for reasons like grocery shopping, going to medical appointments and exercising.

node.title: People Can't Quite Believe McDonald's Used to Have Branded Ashtrays for Smoking Indoors
node.description: "A quarter-pounder, fries, shake, and a few cigarettes is probably the best last meal you could order."
